title: El Camino surprise diner reunion scene explained by Aaron Paul
text:
El Camino is full of surprises (Picture: Ben Rothstein/Netflix via AP)

By now, we’re hoping that you’ve allocated two hours of your time to take in the hotly anticipated Breaking Bad movie, El Camino.

And, if you haven’t: well, look away now because HUGE SPOILERS about the film lie ahead.

Amid all the tension of Jesse Pinkman’s (played by Aaron Paul) quest for redemption and desire to escape his past, Breaking Bad fans were also treated to a number of rather special character reunions.

And, after a ton of speculation, one of the movie’s final scenes finally delivered the big one with the reunion of Jesse and his meth mentor Walter White (Bryan Cranston), with the duo back on screen together for the first time since the original series ended in 2013.

Ahhhhh (Picture: Netflix)

In the brief flashback scene, the pair are seen having breakfast together in a diner around the time of the acclaimed season two episode 4 Days Out as they discuss the future (and Jesse gets to say ‘bitch!’ one more time).

Speaking to Entertainment Weekly about the reunion, Paul said it was ‘so nice’ to be able to play Jesse ‘in his happier days’ again.

‘It was so nice to be able to get in that wardrobe and sit opposite one of my nearest and dearest friends, my mentor, and play these roles again that completely changed our lives forever,’ he said of Cranston’s El Camino involvement.

‘It was really such a blessing.’

The fact that this scene remained unspoiled before El Camino’s release date is a remarkable feat, and Paul revealed how the Breaking Bad team managed to keep the film’s biggest secret by turning the operation into something resembling ‘an undercover mission’.

‘I have such funny videos of Brian and I walking in our sort of Star Wars cloaks, walking from our trailer to the SUV that takes us to set. It was pretty great.’

Reunited, and it feels so good (Picture: Jon Kopaloff/Getty Images)

Paul said that Cranston was flown in to set on a private jet ‘so he wouldn’t have to deal with the public at the airport’, and the pair resisted the urge to go out in public together.

‘But for me that was the easiest part to keep it a secret. I mean, I love throwing surprises. I love surprising my wife. I love lying to people in an innocent way. And this was just that on a big scale.’

The actor also confirmed that most of the customers seen in the diner were either crew members or members of their families – ‘people who we could trust to not leak this information’.

‘We wanted to be surrounded by loved ones, to be a part of this really cool day. The day Bryan came on set with that bald cap and those loafers and that classic Mr. White outfit.

‘I mean, the faces that showed up, the people who flew in just to see this moment, they thought, “Well, look, if I’m going to visit one time, it’s gotta be during this time.”

‘It was pretty cool to be a part of that.’

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie is available on Netflix now.
